verses.plain: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.

tokens.t: Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.

verses.plain: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

tokens.t: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.

verses.plain: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.

tokens.t: For, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not
my transgression, nor
my sin, O

verses.plain: They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.

tokens.t: They run and prepare themselves without
fault: awake to help me, and behold.

verses.plain: Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

tokens.t: Thou therefore, O
God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.

verses.plain: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

tokens.t: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verses.plain: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

tokens.t: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords
in their lips: for who,
, doth hear?

verses.plain: But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

tokens.t: But thou, O
, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.

verses.plain: Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defence.

tokens.t: his strength will I wait upon thee: for God
my defence.

verses.plain: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see my desire upon mine enemies.

tokens.t: The God of my mercy shall prevent me: God shall let me see
upon mine enemies.

verses.plain: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

tokens.t: Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

verses.plain: For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.

tokens.t: the sin of their mouth
the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying
they speak.

verses.plain: Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

tokens.t: Consume
in wrath, consume
, that they
not
and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob unto the ends of the earth. Selah.

verses.plain: And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

tokens.t: And at evening let them return;
let them make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.

verses.plain: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.

tokens.t: Let them wander up and down for meat, and grudge if they be not satisfied.

verses.plain: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

tokens.t: But I will sing of thy power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defence and refuge in the day of my trouble.

verses.plain: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defence, and the God of my mercy.

tokens.t: Unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God
my defence,
the God of my mercy.

footnotes.text: defend…: Heb. set me on high
and grudge…: or, if they be not satisfied, then they will stay all night
